newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish bonds lower, U.S. in focus, outlook unsure.
newsitem.headline: Danish bonds lower, U.S. in focus, outlook unsure.

text.p: Danish bond prices opened lower on Friday and dealers predicted a minor widening of the 10-year yield gap with Germany but were unsure of the market direction after the afternoon's welter of U.S. data.

"The 2006 benchmark should trade within a narrow 114.10-50 margin with the 2007 in the 107.20-60 range. It is very difficult to forecast trends due to the upcoming stream of U.S. data including July job figures and NAPM," one dealer said.
The benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 traded 0.37 point down on Thursday's close at 114.18, yielding 5.84 percent at 0725 GMT.
The seven percent 2007 bond, due to become the benchmark on September 1, slipped 0.38 point to 107.22, with yield at 6.03 percent.
The 2007's 10-year yield gap with Germany was unchanged from Thursday's close at 50 basis points. The crown stood at 3.8091 per mark, firming slightly overnight from 3.8100.
